data.description: Mentored reading, writing, and research for students with dissertator status.
data.title: INDIVIDUAL RESEARCH THESIS

data.description: Survey of Latin syntax and idioms.
data.title: ELEMENTARY PROSE COMPOSITION

data.description: Advanced directed study projects as arranged with a faculty member.
data.title: DIRECTED STUDY

data.description: Through intensive translation and discussion of Vergil's Latin,  hone ability to translate, interpret, and discuss Latin poetry.
data.title: VERGIL

data.description: Individual mentored study for seniors completing theses for Honors in the Major as arranged with a faculty member.
data.title: SENIOR HONORS THESIS

data.description: One of the following: (a) Cicero, Epistles, (b) Pliny, Epistles, (c) Caesar, (d) Sallust, (e) Livy, (f) post Augstan historians, (g) historians of the late Empire.
data.title: LATIN HISTORICAL WRITERS

data.description: Individual mentored study for seniors completing theses, as arranged with a faculty member.
data.title: SENIOR THESIS

data.description: Examine topics relevant to the ancient and modern worlds through analysis of Latin texts.
data.title: SEMINAR-ORATORY

data.description: Forms and syntax, with simple translation.
data.title: FIRST SEMESTER LATIN

data.description: Forms and syntax, with translation of easy prose.
data.title: SECOND SEMESTER LATIN

data.description: One or a combination of: fragments of Lucillius; Horace; Persius, Juvenal; later satire poets.
data.title: ROMAN SATIRE

data.description: One or a combination of : Petronius, Cena Trimalchionis, Satyricon; Apuleius, Cupid and Psyche, Metamorphoses; other Roman novels.
data.title: ROMAN NOVEL

data.description: Plautus, Terence, Seneca, fragmentary remains of Republican drama, and classical and post-classical receptions. Includes discussion of genre, performance, and sociohistorical context
data.title: ROMAN DRAMA

data.description: One of the following: (a) Cicero, Orations, (b) Roman rhetoric.
data.title: LATIN ORATORY

data.description: Individual mentored study for students completing theses for Honors in the Major as arranged with a faculty member.
data.title: HONORS THESIS

data.description: Individual mentored study for seniors completing theses, as arranged with a faculty member.
data.title: SENIOR THESIS

data.description: One of the following: (a) Cicero's philosophical works, (b) Seneca, (c) Latin patristic writers.
data.title: LATIN PHILOSOPHICAL WRITERS

data.description: Brief review of Latin grammar and vocabulary. Extensive reading from several authors.
data.title: THIRD SEMESTER LATIN

data.description: An intensive introduction to the grammar and vocabulary of Classical Latin, the language of ancient Rome. Complete the equivalent ofLATIN 103104 in a single semester. Gain skills in preparation for reading Latin authors in the original. While focus is primarily on written grammar and translation, also touches on aspects of Roman culture, history and literature.
data.title: ELEMENTARY INTENSIVE LATIN

data.description: Latin poetry of the Republic and/or Empire.
data.title: LATIN POETRY

data.description: Introduction to chronological, geographical, and generic range of post-classical Latin, including not only the "medieval" period but the late antique, Renaissance, and beyond.
data.title: MEDIAEVAL LATIN

data.description: Close literary analysis of the structure, style, and language of several Roman poets and prose writers. A critical rather than a purely historical approach to these authors.
data.title: FOURTH SEMESTER LATIN

data.description: Writers of the Republic studied in a historical and cultural context.
data.title: READINGS IN LATIN LITERATURE
